intro: Pleurothallis meridana, commonly known as the golden orchid, is a species of orchid native to the cloud forests of Central and South America. It is a small, epiphytic plant that typically grows on tree branches or rocks in humid, shaded environments. The plant produces delicate, fragrant flowers in shades of yellow and green, which bloom during the rainy season. Its roots are adapted to absorb moisture from the air and decaying organic matter. Pleurothallis meridana is prized for its ornamental value and is often cultivated by enthusiasts due to its unique appearance and ease of care.
